San Franciscans agree tent camps aren’t humane. City still hasn’t found a good solution

It’s clear San Francisco’s tent encampments — the sites of fires, overdoses, sexual assaults and weapon use — can’t be left to fester and grow. But it’s also clear the city’s Healthy Streets Operations Center and its clearing of tents often fail to do much permanent good and that its strategy needs work.
